overview_of_class: Modern genetic theory is a basic underlying principle for all biology. Recent advances have lead to the development of techniques to manipulate genetic information, commonly referred to as "genetic engineering". This course is designed to introduce non-major students to the field of genetics and promote scientific curiosity in the life sciences. Students will learn important concepts of classical genetics and heredity as well as modern techniques of genetic engineering. Particular attention will be given to the role of genetics in disease and evolution and the use of genetic engineering in these areas. The impact of genetic information and genetic engineering on society will also be addressed. There are no prerequisites for this course.
name: Genetics and Evolution
subject: BIOL_SCI
